column4: I am using xubuntu-10.04 on an old PowerPC (Mac G4) and it works really well
(in fact, I am chatting from that computer at the moment)
It works pretty well on my PC even from the usb drive
xubuntu is really good. not as flashy as gnome, but gets the job done, and it does not look so rough as openbox/fluxbox/icewm/etc.
It has 1,47 CPU and 256MB RAM with 40GB Hard
it should be fine. 256 Mb is probably the minimum
consider using openbox/fluxbox or something similar
it's really the apps that would then take all your RAM (browser, openoffice, java being the worst)
if you want to be on the cheap, just buy more RAM -- or talk to friends/work colleagues... that's how I got the RAM for my Mac!
sure I know some friends wit PC hardware shops
pozic: as it happens, some people do keep their old computers, and their memory modules... it's always worth asking
pozic: I am totally amazed as how well xubuntu-10.04 runs on this Mac G4
pozic gotta go. good luck, dzone!
